page.title: 04OCCUPATIONS
page.content: From the returned questionnaires the section on jobs revealed the following information. 22 residents of Ireby working in the village of Ireby either at home, from home or for someone else in the village. The biggest number of people were employed in farming. Other jobs included publican, hotel keeper, haulage contractor, lorry drivers, clergyman, policeman,sub-postmistress, clock/barometer repairer and part-time jobs at the school. Many people had employment in a wide variety of jobs out of Ireby. 7 travel to Carlisle, 4 to Wigton, 4 to Workington, 3 to Keswick, 2 to Aspatria, 1 each to Allonby, Penrith, Cockermouth and 1 to each of the nearby villages of Uldale, Welton, Castle Inn, Bassenthwaite and Hesket. 1 person at Aberdeen and 1 at Tyneside
